lead_paragraph: Part of a prisoner exchange, Matthew Ng says he is now incarcerated for crimes he did not commit in a nation that would not consider his actions illegal.

headline.print_headline: Sent Home, but Only to Another Jail
headline.main: Sent Home to Australia, but Still Jailed for Chinese Crimes

snippet: Part of a prisoner exchange, Matthew Ng says he is now incarcerated for crimes he did not commit in a nation that would not consider his actions illegal.
abstract: Australian businessman Matthew Ng has petitioned government for pardon and immediate release from prison; Ng, working in China and imprisoned there on corruption charges in 2010, has been serving his prison time in Australia since 2014, under bilateral treaty; Australia's attorney general has said chances of pardon are slim, given country's agreement under treaty to administer foreign sentences, even those deemed unreasonable under Australian law.
